required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Marketing Surveillance To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Xyntha® In Subjects With Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Xyntha 'Registered' In Subjects With Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to describe the safety and efficacy of Xyntha® during the usual care setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants by Family History of Factor VIII Inhibitor

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Xyntha Infusions Used to Treat Each New Bleed for On-Demand Therapy (All Participants)
Number of Xyntha Infusions Used to Treat Each New Bleed for On-Demand Therapy in Participants Less Than (<)18 Years of Age
Number of Xyntha Infusions Used to Treat Each New Bleed for On-Demand Therapy in Participants Greater Than or Equal to (≥) 18 Years of Age
Number of Responses by Type of Response for All Xyntha Infusions for Treatment of a Bleed for On-Demand Therapy (All Participants)
secondary_outcome.description: Response categories were excellent, good, moderate, or no response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responses by Type of Response for All Xyntha Infusions for Treatment of a Bleed for On-Demand Therapy in Participants <18 Years of Age
secondary_outcome.description: Response categories were excellent, good, moderate, or no response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responses by Type of Response for All Xyntha Infusions for Treatment of a Bleed for On-Demand Therapy in Participants ≥18 Years of Age
secondary_outcome.description: Response categories were excellent, good, moderate, and no response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Less-Than-Expected Therapeutic Effect (LETE) for On-Demand Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Less than expected therapeutic effect was defined as a 'no response' rating after each of two successive infusions less than or equl to (≤) 24 hours of on-demand therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Infusion Dose Per Bleeding for On-Demand Therapy (All Participants)
Average Infusion Dose Per Bleeding for On-Demand Therapy in Participants <18 Years of Age
Average Infusion Dose Per Bleeding for On-Demand Therapy in Participants ≥18 Years of Age
Percentage of Participants Experiencing Hemorrhages During Prophylaxis

secondary_outcome.description: Annualized bleeding rate defined as total number of breakthrough bleeds within 48 hours (for prophylaxis purpose) divided by (/) [(total period of date of bleeding)/365.25)]

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With LETE Bleeds Within 48 Hours of a Preventive/Prophylaxis Dose of Xyntha
secondary_outcome.description: Less than expected therapeutic effect for prophylaxis therapy defined as breakthrough (spontaneous/non-traumatic) bleed wtihin 48 hours of prophylaxis infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Infusion Dose During Prophylaxis (All Participants)
Average Infusion Dose During Prophylaxis in Participants <18 Years of Age
Average Infusion Dose During Prophylaxis in Participants ≥18 Years of Age
Total Factor Consumption for On-Demand Therapy and During Prophylaxis (All Participants)
Total Factor Consumption for On-Demand Therapy and During Prophylaxis in Participants <18 Years of Age
Total Factor Consumption for On-Demand Therapy and During Prophylaxis in Participants ≥18 Years of Age

arm_group.description: Xyntha will be administered according to physician's discretion.

intervention.description: Xyntha will be administered according to physician's discretion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients or legally authorized representatives of pediatric patients agree to provide written informed consent form (data privacy statement).
- Pediatric and adult patients who have been treated with Xyntha for Hemophilia A from first approved date by KFDA, or who are planned to be newly prescribed Xyntha.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a known history of hypersensitivity to original or reformulated Xyntha or any component of the product.
- Patients with a known history of hypersensitivity to hamster protein.
- Patients participating in an interventional trial of any investigational drug or device.

facility.name: Kim Hugh Chul Internal Medicine Clinic
Kyung Hee University Hospital at Gangdong

outcome.title: Annualized Bleeding Rates During Prophylaxis
outcome.description: Annualized bleeding rate defined as total number of breakthrough bleeds within 48 hours (for prophylaxis purpose) divided by (/) [(total period of date of bleeding)/365.25)]
outcome.population: Data were not analyzed as information on breakthrough bleeds within 48 hours was not collected.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected up to 6 months after the first administration of Xyntha.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another subject, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Xyntha
group.description: Non-interventional, observational study of participants who were prescribed and received at least 1 dose of Xyntha 250, 500, 1000, or 2000 IU.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
